title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Wandering around, around them, forest, I won't get lost because of stat quest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Hello, I'm Josh Starmer and welcome to stat quest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Today we're going to be starting part one of a series on random forests, and we're

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: going to talk about building and evaluating random forests.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Note, random forests are built from decision trees, so if you don't already know about

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: those, check out my stat quest and be-fuck.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Decision trees are easy to build, easy to use, and easy to interpret.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: But in practice, they are not that awesome.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: To quote from the elements of statistical learning, aka the Bible of Machine Learning, trees

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: have one aspect that prevents them from being the ideal tool for predictive learning, namely

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: in accuracy.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In other words, they work great with the data used to create them, but they are not flexible

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: when it comes to classifying new samples.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The good news is that random forests combine the simplicity of decision trees with flexibility

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: resulting in a vast improvement in accuracy.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: So let's make a random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Step one, create a bootstrap dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Imagine that these four samples are the entire dataset that we are going to build a tree

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: from.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: I know it's crazy small, but just pretend for now.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: To create a bootstrap dataset that is the same size as the original, we just randomly

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: select samples from the original dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The important detail is that we're allowed to pick the same sample more than once.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This is the first sample that we randomly select.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: So it's the first sample in our bootstrap dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This is the second randomly selected sample from the original dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: So it's the second sample in our bootstrap dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Here's the third randomly selected sample.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: So here it is in the bootstrap dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Lastly, here's the fourth randomly selected sample.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Note, it's the same as the third.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And here it is.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Bam, we've created a bootstrap dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Step two for creating a random forest is to create a decision tree using the bootstrap

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: dataset, but only use a random subset of variables or columns at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In this example, we will only consider two variables or columns at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Note, we'll talk more about how to determine the optimal number of variables to consider later.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Thus, instead of considering all four variables to figure out how to split the root node,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: we randomly select two.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In this case, we randomly selected good blood circulation and blocked arteries as candidates for the root node.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Just for the sake of the example, assume that good blood circulation did the best job separating the samples.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Since we used good blood circulation, I'm going to gray it out so that we focus on the remaining variables.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Now we need to figure out how to split samples at this node.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Just like for the root, we randomly select two variables as candidates instead of all three remaining columns.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And we just build the tree as usual, but only considering a random subset of variables at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Double bound.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: We built a tree, one, using a bootstrap dataset, and two, only considering a random subset of variables at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Here's the tree we just made.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Now, go back to step one and repeat.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Make a new bootstrap dataset and build a tree considering a subset of variables at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Ideally, you do this hundreds of times, but we only have space to show six.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: But you get the idea.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Using a bootstrap sample and considering only a subset of variables at each step results in a wide variety of trees.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The variety is what makes random forests more effective than individual decision trees.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Sweet.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Now that we've created a random forest, how do we use it?

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Well, first we get a new patient.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: We've got all the measurements.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And now we want to know if they have heart disease or not.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: So we take the data and run it down the first tree that we made.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Boo-bba-doo- OH.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The first tree says yes.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The patient has heart disease.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And we keep track of that here.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Now we run the dataset down the second tree that we made.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The second tree also says yes,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and we keep track of that here.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And then we repeat for all the trees we made.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: After running the data down all of the trees in the random forest,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: we see which option received more votes.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In this case, yes, received the most votes,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: so we will conclude that this patient has heart disease.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Bam.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Oh no, terminology alert.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Bootstrapping the data,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: plus using the aggregate to make a decision, is called bagging.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: OK, now we've seen how to create and use a random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: How do we know if it's any good?

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Remember when we created the Bootstrapped dataset?

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: We allowed duplicate entries in the Bootstrapped dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: As a result, this entry was not included in the Bootstrapped dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Typically, about one third of the original data

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: does not end up in the Bootstrapped dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Here's the entry that didn't end up in the Bootstrapped dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: If the original dataset were larger,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: we'd have more than just one entry over here.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This is called the Out of Bag dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: If it were up to me, I would have named it the Out of Boot dataset,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: since it's the entries that didn't make it into the Bootstrapped dataset.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Unfortunately, it's not up to me.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Since the Out of Bag data was not used to create this tree,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: we can run it through and see if it correctly classifies the sample as no heart disease.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In this case, the tree correctly labels the Out of Bag sample, no.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Then we run this Out of Bag sample

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: through all of the other trees that were built without it.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This tree incorrectly labeled the Out of Bag sample, yes.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: These trees correctly labeled the Out of Bag sample, no.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Since the label with the most votes wins,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: it is the label that we assign this Out of Bag sample.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In this case, the Out of Bag sample is correctly labeled by the random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: We then do the same thing for all of the Out of Bag samples for all of the trees.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This Out of Bag sample was also correctly labeled.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: This Out of Bag sample was incorrectly labeled.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Et cetera, et cetera, et cetera.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Ultimately, we can measure how accurate our random forest is

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: by the proportion of Out of Bag samples that were correctly classified by the random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: The proportion of Out of Bag samples that were incorrectly classified is the Out of Bag error.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Okay, we now know how to 1 build a random forest, 2 use a random forest,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and 3 estimate the accuracy of a random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: However, now that we know how to do this,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: we can talk a little more about how to do this.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Remember when we built our first tree, and we only use two variables, columns of data,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: to make a decision at each step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Now we can compare the Out of Bag error for a random forest,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: built using only two variables per step,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: to a random forest, built using three variables per step.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: And we test a bunch of different settings, and choose the most accurate random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: In other words, 1, we build a random forest,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and then 2, we estimate the accuracy of a random forest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Then we change the number of variables used per step,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and we do this a bunch of times, and then choose the one that is the most accurate.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Typically, we start by using the square of the number of variables,

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and then try a few settings above and below that value.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Triple ban.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Hooray, we've made it to the end of another exciting stat quest.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: Tune in next week, and we'll talk about how to deal with missing data

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: and how to cluster the samples.

title: StatQuest: Random Forests Part 1 - Building, Using and Evaluating
text: All right, until then, quest on.
